If it passes the House, it has a good chance of passing the Senate, and the Governor has already said he’ll sign it.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

This is not a drill. The South Carolina House of Representatives is set to begin debate on H.3020 at 11 a.m. today, April 24. This is a bill that would ban abortion around 6 weeks, before most women know they are pregnant. If this bill passes through the House, it is likely to pass through the Senate. From there, it lands on Governor McMaster’s desk, where he’s pledged to sign it into law.

We know the true intent of this bill is to outright ban all abortions in South Carolina. This ignores the fact that polls show that seven in ten Americans support legal access to abortion. These bans are not about protecting women’s health and well-being. They are about advancing a political and ideological agenda.

Can you show up to let lawmakers know that you won’t stand for this blatant attack on women’s healthcare? Can you write emails and flood phonelines with calls to let our elected officials know that individuals who get pregnant, along with their doctors, are the only ones who should be making decisions about healthcare?

We need you NOW. We cannot let this dangerous bill leave the House floor. Find and contact your legislator today!

Join in solidarity Wednesday, April 24 at 11 a.m. at 1100 Gervais Street, Columbia, SC 29208.

Follow us on Facebook and Twitter for the latest updates on civil rights and liberties.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of South Carolina
